basics.name: Vladimir Petrov
basics.summary: PhD Student in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Iowa, focusing on robotics, machine learning, and autonomous systems.

work.summary: Developed and implemented trajectory generation and tracking algorithms for coordinated flights of multiple Crazyflie drones in constrained environments using ROS2 and CrazySwarm2; employed SLAM Toolbox for independent drone localization; merged 2D maps into 3D point clouds; validated algorithms with RViz2.

work.company: University of Iowa, Cooperative Autonomous Systems Lab
work.summary: Implement control and learning algorithms for AUVs and UAVs, including PID, LQR, MPC, NMPC, L1 adaptive control, and RBFNN, LSTM, Transformer with TensorFlow; conducted trajectory optimization, path planning, obstacle avoidance, and SLAM using C++, Python, Gazebo, Simulink, and MATLAB; authored publications AUV and UAV controls.

Led a team of 24 design engineers in R&D of Delta, Articulated, Cartesian, SCARA, and Polar robots; managed CAD development in Autodesk Inventor and Siemens NX; performed motion, statics, dynamics, stress, and deflection simulations in ANSYS.
Designed Cartesian/Gantry and Delta robots; created CAD models in Solidworks; performed simulations and calculations in ANSYS and Simulationx.
Developed Delta and Articulated robots; modeled in Solidworks and Creo; conducted simulations in Simulationx.

education.summary: Thesis: Development of diesel fuel system; Activities: Student council, Local charity organization
